question: A Singly Linked List allows traversal in ________ direction only.
In a Singly Linked List, the last node points to ________.
A Circular Linked List does not have a ________ node.
A Doubly Linked List allows traversal in ________ directions.
Each node in a Doubly Linked List contains two pointers: one to the next node and one to the ________ node.
A Singly Linked List uses ________ pointer per node.
In a Circular Linked List, the last node points to the ________ node.
The extra pointer in a Doubly Linked List increases ________ usage.
The traversal of a Circular Linked List continues in a ________ loop.
A Singly Linked List is ________ to implement compared to a Doubly Linked List.
Each node in a Singly Linked List has two parts: data and a ________ to the next node.
Circular Linked Lists are commonly used in ________ scheduling.
A Doubly Linked List allows ________ traversal of elements.
A Circular Linked List is beneficial in applications where elements need to be processed in a ________ manner.
Insertion at the beginning of a Singly Linked List requires updating the ________ pointer.
A Singly Linked List is not suitable for ________ traversal.
A Circular Linked List does not contain a ________ pointer.
A Doubly Linked List requires more ________ than a Singly Linked List.
In a Doubly Linked List, the last nodeâ€™s next pointer is ________.
A Circular Linked List is useful when there is a need for a ________ loop.
A Doubly Linked List can be traversed using both the next and ________ pointers.
In a Singly Linked List, deletion of the last node requires traversal from the ________ node.
A Circular Linked List can be implemented using both Singly and ________ Linked Lists.
Each node in a Circular Linked List has a pointer that links it to the ________ node.
The Circular Linked List does not have an explicit ________ pointer.
The time complexity of inserting an element at the beginning of a Singly Linked List is ________.
A Singly Linked List is not ideal for applications that require ________ lookup.
A Doubly Linked List provides a more efficient way to delete a node without requiring ________ traversal.
In a Circular Linked List, the traversal can be done from any node as there is no ________ node.
Doubly Linked Lists allow insertion and deletion at both ends with ________ time complexity.
